body_html: @jart thanks for pointing to the updated #4852. However, I'm not sure if it is related to numpy in my case? I see in the log of #4852 that something with numpy happens. This is not the case in my code. The model I want to save was stored by TF with early_stop_name = self.saver.save(self.sess, save_path=_path). No numpy involved inbetween this saving and restoring a few lines later. Also, it seems that according to the error message above it wants to access some systemd temp file, which it should not try to access.

body: @jart thanks for pointing to the updated #4852. However, I'm not sure if it is related to `numpy` in my case? I see in the log of #4852 that something with `numpy` happens. This is not the case in my code. The model I want to save was stored by TF with `early_stop_name = self.saver.save(self.sess, save_path=_path)`. No numpy involved inbetween this saving and restoring a few lines later. Also, it seems that according to the error message above it wants to access some `systemd` temp file, which it should not try to access.
